bytes.description: The size of this resource in bytes.
bytes.title: Bytes

caseSensitiveHeader.context: Use of case in source CSV files is not always an intentional decision. For example, should "CAT" and "Cat" be considered to have the same meaning.
caseSensitiveHeader.description: Specifies if the case of headers is meaningful.
caseSensitiveHeader.title: Case Sensitive Header

commentChar.description: Specifies that any row beginning with this one-character string, without preceeding whitespace, causes the entire line to be ignored.
commentChar.title: Comment Character

contributor.context: Use of this property does not imply that the person was the original creator of, or a contributor to, the data in the descriptor, but refers to the composition of the descriptor itself.

organization.description: An organizational affiliation for this contributor.
organization.title: Organization

contributor.title: Contributor

countryCode.description: A valid 2-digit ISO country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2), or, an array of valid ISO codes.
countryCode.title: ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 Country code

created.context: The datetime must conform to the string formats for datetime as described in [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)
created.description: The datetime on which this descriptor was created.
created.title: Created

csvddfVersion.description: A number to indicate the schema version of CSV Dialect. Version 1.0 was named CSV Dialect Description Format and used different field names.
csvddfVersion.title: CSV Dialect schema version

licenses.description: The license(s) under which the resource is published.

dataResources.description: An `array` of Data Resource objects, each compliant with the [Data Resource](/data-resource/) specification.
dataResources.title: Data Resources

delimiter.description: A character sequence to use as the field separator.
delimiter.title: Delimiter

description.description: A text description. Markdown is encouraged.
examples:
# My Package description
All about my package.
description.title: Description

doubleQuote.context: If Double Quote is set to true, two consecutive quotes must be interpreted as one.
doubleQuote.description: Specifies the handling of quotes inside fields.
doubleQuote.title: Double Quote

encoding.description: The file encoding of this resource.
encoding.title: Encoding

escapeChar.description: Specifies a one-character string to use as the escape character.
escapeChar.title: Escape Character

attributes.description: Attribute objects that make up the dimension
attributes.title: Attributes

dimensionType.description: Describes what kind of a dimension it is.
dimensionType.title: Dimension Type

primaryKey.description: Either an array of strings corresponding to the name attributes in a set of field objects in the fields array or a single string corresponding to one of these names. The value of primaryKey indicates the primary key or primary keys for the dimension.
primaryKey.title: Primary Key

direction.description: A keyword that represents the direction of the spend, either expenditure or revenue.
direction.title: Direction of the spending

phase.description: A keyword that represents the phase of the data, can be proposed for a budget proposal, approved for an approved budget, adjusted for modified budget or executed for the enacted budget
phase.title: Budget phase

dimensions.description: Dimensions are groups of related fields. Dimensions cover all items other than the measure.
dimensions.title: Dimensions

measures.description: Measures are numerical and correspond to financial amounts in the source data.
measures.title: Measures

format.description: The file format of this resource.
format.title: Format

hash.description: The MD5 hash of this resource. Indicate other hashing algorithms with the {algorithm}:{hash} format.
hash.title: Hash

header.description: Specifies if the file includes a header row, always as the first row in the file.
header.title: Header

homepage.description: The home on the web that is related to this data package.
homepage.title: Home Page

id.context: A common usage pattern for Data Packages is as a packaging format within the bounds of a system or platform. In these cases, a unique identifier for a package is desired for common data handling workflows, such as updating an existing package. While at the level of the specification, global uniqueness cannot be validated, consumers using the `id` property `MUST` ensure identifiers are globally unique.
id.description: A property reserved for globally unique identifiers. Examples of identifiers that are unique include UUIDs and DOIs.
id.title: ID

image.description: A image to represent this package.
image.title: Image

keywords.description: A list of keywords that describe this package.
keywords.title: Keywords

license.context: Use of this property does not imply that the person was the original creator of, or a contributor to, the data in the descriptor, but refers to the composition of the descriptor itself.

name.description: MUST be an Open Definition license identifier, see http://licenses.opendefinition.org/
name.title: Open Definition license identifier

license.title: License

licenses.context: This property is not legally binding and does not guarantee that the package is licensed under the terms defined herein.
licenses.description: The license(s) under which this package is published.

examples.name: odc-pddl-1.0
examples.title: Open Data Commons Public Domain Dedication and License v1.0

licenses.title: Licenses

lineTerminator.description: Specifies the character sequence that must be used to terminate rows.
lineTerminator.title: Line Terminator

mediatype.description: The media type of this resource. Can be any valid media type listed with [IANA](https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml).
mediatype.title: Media Type

name.context: This is ideally a url-usable and human-readable name. Name `SHOULD` be invariant, meaning it `SHOULD NOT` change when its parent descriptor is updated.
name.description: An identifier string. Lower case characters with `.`, `_`, `-` and `/` are allowed.
name.title: Name

nullSequence.description: Specifies the null sequence, for example, `\0`.
nullSequence.title: Null Sequence

path.context: Implementations need to negotiate the type of path provided, and dereference the data accordingly.
path.description: A fully qualified URL, or a POSIX file path.
path.title: Path

profile.context: Every Package and Resource descriptor has a profile. The default profile, if none is declared, is `data-package` for Package and `data-resource` for Resource.
profile.title: Profile

quoteChar.description: Specifies a one-character string to use as the quoting character.
quoteChar.title: Quote Character

resourcePath.context: The dereferenced value of each referenced data source in `path` `MUST` be commensurate with a native, dereferenced representation of the data the resource describes. For example, in a *Tabular* Data Resource, this means that the dereferenced value of `path` `MUST` be an array.
resourcePath.description: A reference to the data for this resource, as either a path as a string, or an array of paths as strings. of valid URIs.
resourcePath.title: Path

skipInitialSpace.description: Specifies the interpretation of whitespace immediately following a delimiter. If false, whitespace immediately after a delimiter should be treated as part of the subsequent field.
skipInitialSpace.title: Skip Initial Space

sources.description: The raw sources for this resource.
sources.title: Sources

tableSchema.description: A Table Schema for this resource, compliant with the [Table Schema](/tableschema/) specification.

fields.description: An `array` of Table Schema Field objects.

tableSchema.title: Table Schema

tableSchemaBareNumber.description: a boolean field with a default of `true`. If `true` the physical contents of this field must follow the formatting constraints already set out. If `false` the contents of this field may contain leading and/or trailing non-numeric characters (which implementors MUST therefore strip). The purpose of `bareNumber` is to allow publishers to publish numeric data that contains trailing characters such as percentages e.g. `95%` or leading characters such as currencies e.g. `â‚¬95` or `EUR 95`. Note that it is entirely up to implementors what, if anything, they do with stripped text.
tableSchemaBareNumber.title: bareNumber

tableSchemaConstraintMaxLength.description: An integer that specifies the maximum length of a value.

tableSchemaConstraintMinLength.description: An integer that specifies the minimum length of a value.

tableSchemaConstraintPattern.context: Regular expressions `SHOULD` conform to the [XML Schema regular expression syntax](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#regexs).
tableSchemaConstraintPattern.description: A regular expression pattern to test each value of the property against, where a truthy response indicates validity.

tableSchemaConstraintRequired.context: An empty string is considered to be a missing value.
tableSchemaConstraintRequired.description: Indicates whether a property must have a value for each instance.

tableSchemaConstraintUnique.description: When `true`, each value for the property `MUST` be unique.

tableSchemaFieldAny.description: Any value is accepted, including values that are not captured by the type/format/constraint requirements of the specification.

constraints.description: The following constraints apply to `any` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `any`.

tableSchemaFieldAny.title: Any Field

tableSchemaFieldArray.description: The field contains data which can be parsed as a valid JSON array.

constraints.description: The following constraints apply for `array` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.description: There are no format keyword options for `array`: only `default` is allowed.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `array`.

tableSchemaFieldArray.title: Array Field

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `boolean` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.description: There are no format keyword options for `boolean`: only `default` is allowed.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `boolean`.

tableSchemaFieldDate.description: The field contains temporal date values.

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `date` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.context:
The following `format` options are supported:
  * **default**: An ISO8601 format string of YYYY-MM-DD.
  * **any**: Any parsable representation of a date. The implementing library can attempt to parse the datetime via a range of strategies.
  * **{PATTERN}**: The value can be parsed according to `{PATTERN}`, which `MUST` follow the date formatting syntax of C / Python [strftime](http://strftime.org/).
format.description: The format keyword options for `date` are `default`, `any`, and `{PATTERN}`.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `date`.

tableSchemaFieldDate.title: Date Field

tableSchemaFieldDateTime.description: The field contains temporal datetime values.

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `datetime` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.context:
The following `format` options are supported:
  * **default**: An ISO8601 format string for datetime.
  * **any**: Any parsable representation of a date. The implementing library can attempt to parse the datetime via a range of strategies.
  * **{PATTERN}**: The value can be parsed according to `{PATTERN}`, which `MUST` follow the date formatting syntax of C / Python [strftime](http://strftime.org/).
format.description: The format keyword options for `datetime` are `default`, `any`, and `{PATTERN}`.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `datetime`.

tableSchemaFieldDateTime.title: Date Time Field

tableSchemaFieldDuration.context: The lexical representation for duration is the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations) extended format `PnYnMnDTnHnMnS`, where `nY` represents the number of years, `nM` the number of months, `nD` the number of days, 'T' is the date/time separator, `nH` the number of hours, `nM` the number of minutes and `nS` the number of seconds. The number of seconds can include decimal digits to arbitrary precision. Date and time elements including their designator may be omitted if their value is zero, and lower order elements may also be omitted for reduced precision. Here we follow the definition of [XML Schema duration datatype](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#duration) directly and that definition is implicitly inlined here.
tableSchemaFieldDuration.description: The field contains a duration of time.

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `duration` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.description: There are no format keyword options for `duration`: only `default` is allowed.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `duration`.

tableSchemaFieldDuration.title: Duration Field

tableSchemaFieldGeoJSON.description: The field contains a JSON object according to GeoJSON or TopoJSON

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `geojson` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.context:
The following `format` options are supported:
  * **default**: A geojson object as per the [GeoJSON spec](http://geojson.org/).
  * **topojson**: A topojson object as per the [TopoJSON spec](https://github.com/topojson/topojson-specification/blob/master/README.md)
format.description: The format keyword options for `geojson` are `default` and `topojson`.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `geojson`.

tableSchemaFieldGeoJSON.title: GeoJSON Field

tableSchemaFieldGeoPoint.description: The field contains data describing a geographic point.

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `geopoint` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.context:
The following `format` options are supported:
  * **default**: A string of the pattern 'lon, lat', where `lon` is the longitude and `lat` is the latitude.
  * **array**: An array of exactly two items, where each item is either a number, or a string parsable as a number, and the first item is `lon` and the second item is `lat`.
  * **object**: A JSON object with exactly two keys, `lat` and `lon`
format.description: The format keyword options for `geopoint` are `default`,`array`, and `object`.
notes: Implementations `MUST` strip all white space in the default format of `lon, lat`.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `geopoint`.

tableSchemaFieldGeoPoint.title: GeoPoint Field

tableSchemaFieldInteger.context: Integer values are indicated in the standard way for any valid integer.
tableSchemaFieldInteger.description: The field contains integers - that is whole numbers.

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `integer` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.description: There are no format keyword options for `integer`: only `default` is allowed.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `integer`.

tableSchemaFieldInteger.title: Integer Field

tableSchemaFieldNumber.context:
The lexical formatting follows that of decimal in [XMLSchema](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#decimal): a non-empty finite-length sequence of decimal digits separated by a period as a decimal indicator. An optional leading sign is allowed. If the sign is omitted, '+' is assumed. Leading and trailing zeroes are optional. If the fractional part is zero, the period and following zero(es) can be omitted. For example: '-1.23', '12678967.543233', '+100000.00', '210'.

The following special string values are permitted (case does not need to be respected):
  - NaN: not a number
  - INF: positive infinity
  - -INF: negative infinity

A number `MAY` also have a trailing:
  - exponent: this `MUST` consist of an E followed by an optional + or - sign followed by one or more decimal digits (0-9)
  - percentage: the percentage sign: `%`. In conversion percentages should be divided by 100.

If both exponent and percentages are present the percentage `MUST` follow the exponent e.g. '53E10%' (equals 5.3).
tableSchemaFieldNumber.description: The field contains numbers of any kind including decimals.

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `number` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

decimalChar.description: A string whose value is used to represent a decimal point within the number. The default value is `.`.

format.description: There are no format keyword options for `number`: only `default` is allowed.

groupChar.description: A string whose value is used to group digits within the number. The default value is `null`. A common value is `,` e.g. '100,000'.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `number`.

tableSchemaFieldNumber.title: Number Field

tableSchemaFieldObject.description: The field contains data which can be parsed as a valid JSON object.

constraints.description: The following constraints apply for `object` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.description: There are no format keyword options for `object`: only `default` is allowed.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `object`.

tableSchemaFieldObject.title: Object Field

tableSchemaFieldString.description: The field contains strings, that is, sequences of characters.

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `string` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.context:
The following `format` options are supported:
  * **default**: any valid string.
  * **email**: A valid email address.
  * **uri**: A valid URI.
  * **binary**: A base64 encoded string representing binary data.
  * **uuid**: A string that is a uuid.
format.description: The format keyword options for `string` are `default`, `email`, `uri`, `binary`, and `uuid`.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `string`.

tableSchemaFieldString.title: String Field

tableSchemaFieldTime.description: The field contains temporal time values.

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `time` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.context:
The following `format` options are supported:
  * **default**: An ISO8601 format string for time.
  * **any**: Any parsable representation of a date. The implementing library can attempt to parse the datetime via a range of strategies.
  * **{PATTERN}**: The value can be parsed according to `{PATTERN}`, which `MUST` follow the date formatting syntax of C / Python [strftime](http://strftime.org/).
format.description: The format keyword options for `time` are `default`, `any`, and `{PATTERN}`.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `time`.

tableSchemaFieldTime.title: Time Field

tableSchemaFieldYear.description: A calendar year, being an integer with 4 digits. Equivalent to [gYear in XML Schema](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#gYear)

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `year` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.description: There are no format keyword options for `year`: only `default` is allowed.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `year`.

tableSchemaFieldYear.title: Year Field

tableSchemaFieldYearMonth.description: A calendar year month, being an integer with 1 or 2 digits. Equivalent to [gYearMonth in XML Schema](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#gYearMonth)

constraints.description: The following constraints are supported for `yearmonth` fields.
constraints.title: Constraints

format.description: There are no format keyword options for `yearmonth`: only `default` is allowed.

type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `yearmonth`.

tableSchemaFieldYearMonth.title: Year Month Field

items.description: Fields that make up the primary key.

fields.description: Fields that make up the primary key.

tableSchemaMissingValues.context:
Many datasets arrive with missing data values, either because a value was not collected or it never existed.
Missing values may be indicated simply by the value being empty in other cases a special value may have been used e.g. `-`, `NaN`, `0`, `-9999` etc.
The `missingValues` property provides a way to indicate that these values should be interpreted as equivalent to null.

`missingValues` are strings rather than being the data type of the particular field. This allows for comparison prior to casting and for fields to have missing value which are not of their type, for example a `number` field to have missing values indicated by `-`.

The default value of `missingValue` for a non-string type field is the empty string `''`. For string type fields there is no default for `missingValue` (for string fields the empty string `''` is a valid value and need not indicate null).
tableSchemaMissingValues.description: Values that when encountered in the source, should be considered as `null`, 'not present', or 'blank' values.

tableSchemaPrimaryKey.context: Field name in the `primaryKey` `MUST` be unique, and `MUST` match a field name in the associated table. It is acceptable to have an array with a single value, indicating that the value of a single field is the primary key.
tableSchemaPrimaryKey.description: A primary key is a field name or an array of field names, whose values `MUST` uniquely identify each row in the table.

tableSchemaRdfType.description: The RDF type for this field.

licenses.description: The license(s) under which the resource is published.

tabularDataResources.description: An `array` of Tabular Data Resource objects, each compliant with the [Tabular Data Resource](/tabular-data-resource/) specification.
tabularDataResources.title: Tabular Data Resources

version.description: A unique version number for this descriptor.
version.title: Version
